avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are found in the mountains on W facing aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant amount of snow has been deposited in stiff easterlies lately. Wind slabs have formed in the mountains on W facing aspects. Not much snow was present before the start of the week except in upper elevations and inland, but older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase in South Iceland due to avalanche danger was cancelled on Saturday morning but there is a lot of new snow in Mýrdalur. Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. The most snow has been in North parts and in northerlies earlier this week snow was deposited on souther aspects but over the weekend, loose snow has blown onto north facing aspects. A persistant weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. A persistent weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.

weatherForecast.highlights: Vestan 3-10 og stöku él á laugardag, hiti kringum frostmark. Snýst í norðaustan 5-13 á sunnudag. Þurrt að mestu og kólnar næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Updated 20.1. at 20:15: Considerable new snow on Saturday and Sunday, drifting in NE winds. Before there was little snow.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A bit of snow fell on Saturday in light wind. Before, there was little snow in the area, on top of either bare ground or old and stable hardpacked snow. More snowfall is expected on Saturday night and Sunday in NE wind. New unstable wind slabs might form.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase in South Iceland due to avalanche danger was cancelled on Saturday morning but there is a lot of new snow in Mýrdalur. travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs are present in most parts after snow fall and variable winds this week. A persistent weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma í NA átt á laugardagskvöld og sunnudag. Styttir upp á mánudag, stöku él á þriðjudag. Vægt frost.

avalancheActivity.comment: An avalanche was reported on a S aspect in Hrafnabjargarhnjúkur, Karlsárdalur on Thursday. The avalanche is likely to have released on the interface between older firn and wind slab that formed this week. A large slab avalanche size 2.5 and two smaller ones, one remote triggered released in Burstarbrekkudalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: At the interface of new snow with older firn, weakness has developed, and faceting has occurred in that layer during the recent frosty days. There has been significant snowfall in the past week, in various wind directions. And therefore, snow has accumulated on various aspects on top of the weak layer.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant amount of new snow this week and blowing on various aspects, mostly S-facing. On the interface between new and old snow a widespread weakness is likely to have weakened in the cold temperatures lately and thick wind slabs are overlying this layer in places. This last week has been very cold, enhancing the temperature gradient in the snow pack. A snow pit from Leyningssúlur, near Siglufjörður on NE-aspect Jan 17th, showed a steep temperature gradient and faceting. Stability tests gave a sudden planar fracture at medium load on the interface between firn and new snow. Whumpfs and a remote triggered avalanche observed recently indicate a widespread weakness underneath new snow.

A persistant weakness is widespread in N- and E-Iceland and has developed during cold temperatures.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snýst í suðvestan 5-13 með stöku éljum seinnipart laugardags. Frost 0 til 5 stig. Bjart veður á sunnudag og kólnar. Stöku él á mánudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few slab avalanches were seen in Eskifjörður, probably released during or after the snowfall on Tuesday, 16.1.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable snow was added the night before Saturday and drifted in E winds. Before, recent wind slabs lay on top of stable hardpacked snow and between them a weak layer with facets have been found.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable snow was added the night before Saturday, especially in the southern part of the forecast area, and drifted in E winds. Before, recent winds slabs were widely, especially in south and east facing slopes, after snowfall and snowdrift last Tuesday. Underneath is stable hardpacked snow, and between those two a weak layer with facets has been found. The weak layer and the wind slabs on top increase the likelihood of human triggered avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: Vestlægar áttir, úrkomulítið og frost næstu daga. Smá él í norðanátt úti með ströndum á sunnudagskvöld.
